snippet: The I.P.O. was aimed squarely at small investors, people who might otherwise have added to savings accounts with the postal service.
abstract: Shares of Japan Post Holdings debut at 1,631 yen, or $13.49, per share, 16.5 percent higher than initial public offering price, and close at 1,760 yen; privatization of Japan Post, which is nation's postal service and biggest bank and life insurer, is part of plan to boost asset prices by convincing small investors to transfer some of their savings into stocks.
lead_paragraph: The I.P.O. was aimed squarely at small investors, people who might otherwise have added to savings accounts with the postal service.

headline.main: Japan Post in Strong Stock Market Debut in Tokyo
headline.print_headline: Japan Post Shares Soar in I.P.O. Aimed at Small Investors
